paper.title: On the Security of Remotely Keyed Encryption
paper.abstract: The purpose of remotely keyed encryption is to efficiently realize a secret-key block cipher by sharing the computational burden between a fast untrusted device and a slow device trusted with the key. This paper deals with how to define the security of remotely keyed encryption schemes. Since the attacker can take over the slow device and actually take part in the encryption process, common definitions of the security of block ciphers have to be reconsidered.
